value: content=provides schedule passenger service from major airports in China, including Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou, Nanjing, Xuzhou, Ningbo, Guilin, Dalian, Shenyang, Guilin, Shenzhen.
content=has many direct connections to major cities in China, including, Beijing, Shanghai, Hangzhou, Changzhou, Suzhou, Urumqi, Changzhou, Taiyuan etc.

Taxi's are readily available and easy to flag.

value: content=Huāguǒshān and Shuǐliándòng (水帘洞), the home of the legendary Monkey King (孙悟空) in the famous story,
directions=From city center catch Xinpu-Lianyun Train (新浦至连云专线), transfer to bus 31
content=On the coast to the NE of Lianyungang.

directions=From city center catch bus 101, 102, 103, 104 or 105 to Xugou, transfer at the Xugou KFC to bus 33. This will drop you off near the first beach. Walk to the right along the wooden pathway for a 30 minutes to get to the small private beach.
price=50 yuan (or buy a tourist card in XinPu for 68 and get into Monkey Mountain and the beach)

On Lianyungang Island, there are a couple of nice hotels near the beach.  As of May 2012, prices were approximately 150RMB.  Service wasn't too great, but location is fantastic.  There are some mediocre and over priced restaurants in the vicinity, but they have a nice view.  There are some local seafood restaurants nearby. These are also overpriced but there are too many of them, so you can bargain over the price.
Get here from Lianyungang dong (east) station.  It's about a 30-40RMB taxi ride.  There are buses available in the daytime.
